com.camerontec.util.pool

Interface IReferencePool<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The referent object type.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    UnboundedReferencePool

    public interface IReferencePool<T>
    Interface to be implemented by objects capable of maintaining a pool of references, each referring to a concrete referent object.

    Object pools are generally used in situations where garbage creation is not desired. Typically in such cases there is an explicit trade-off between memory consumption and the desired to avoid garbage collection. Therefore, implementations must guarantee not only that garbage associated with reference objects is not created, but also that garbage associated with house keeping of the pool itself does not result in garbage. That rules out the use of many of the standard Java collections for such tasks.

    It is common for collections to wrap their elements in some kind of container to make house keeping easier. This leads to a cleaner API, however, often comes at the cost of garbage creation. Here we take slightly different approach and expose the underlying element container (PoolableReference) to clients. This slight overhead in terms of complexity is a trade off against garbage creation. That is, it is far easier to write garbage free implementations with this scheme in place.

    This interface makes no guarantees regarding thread safety in the presence of concurrent invocation of its methods in separate threads. Such details are implementation dependent.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkIn(PoolableReference<T> element)
      Check in a previously checked out object reference to the pool making it available again for subsequent check out.
      void checkInAll()
      Check in all references that are currently checked out of the pool.
      PoolableReference<T> checkOut()
      Check out a reference from the pool.

    • Method Detail

      • checkOut

        PoolableReference<T> checkOut()
        Check out a reference from the pool.
        Returns:
        The next free reference from the pool.

      • checkIn

        void checkIn(PoolableReference<T> element)
        Check in a previously checked out object reference to the pool making it available again for subsequent check out.
        Parameters:
        element - The reference to check back in to the pool.

      • checkInAll

        void checkInAll()
        Check in all references that are currently checked out of the pool.

        This is an optional operation and is only supported by implementations which track checked out references.

        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - If this operation is not supported.
